text: I don't know why, but the older I get the more interested I get in my parents' marriage. And it's interesting to be married yourself, too, because there is an inevitable comparison.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

text: My parents had an arranged marriage, as did so many other people when I was growing up. My father came and had a life in the United States one way and my mother had a different one, and I was very aware of those things. I continue to wonder about it, and I will continue to write about it.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

text: I am fairly classless because it is very difficult to class someone who comes from a mixed marriage.
author: Sade Adu

text: There is a big misconception about arranged marriage. Yes, it can mean that you meet someone and then have to marry them, but this was my mother saying, 'I'm going to introduce you to so-and-so - If you don't like them, fair enough.'
author: Archie Panjabi

text: Marriage is an institution and that's where a couple finish up.
author: Les Dawson
